author: Deleted User
content: I know this maybe only tangentially related, but here is something I just realised (why I didn't think of this before?). In Bitcoin p2p network, there are primitives `getaddr` and `addr` to get able to discover new peers via other peers. Ethereum does not have that, and discovery relies on 3 things 1) hard-coded peers 2) DHT, 3) DNS "-disco.net". I wonder what was the rationale for not doing `getaddr` and `addr`?
